Package net.royalur.notation

Class RGN

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.royalur.notation.Notation
      • net.royalur.notation.RGN
  • public class RGN
extends Notation
    RGN stands for Royal Game Notation. This is a textual format that is intended to be readable by both humans and machines. This notation is inspired by Chess' PGN (Portable Game Notation).

    Additional thanks to the following contributors from the Royal Game of Ur Discord server for their help in discussing the merits of different features for the notation: Monomino, Sachertorte, and Diego Raposo.

        public final int maxActionLineLength
        The maximum length of the lines that contain moves. This does not apply to the metadata lines.

      • appendDiceRoll

        protected <P extends Piece,​S extends PlayerState,​R extends Roll> void appendDiceRoll​(@Nonnull
                                                                                                 RuleSet<P,​S,​R> rules,
                                                                                                 @Nonnull
                                                                                                 java.lang.StringBuilder builder,
                                                                                                 @Nonnull
                                                                                                 RolledGameState<P,​S,​R> rolledState)
        Encodes the dice roll from rolledState into builder.
        Type Parameters:
        P - The type of pieces that exist on the board in the given state.
        S - The type of the player state that is stored in the given state.
        R - The type of the dice rolls that was made in the given state.
        Parameters:
        rules - The rules of the game in which the dice are being encoded.
        builder - The builder into which to append the encoded dice roll.
        rolledState - The state of the game that contains the dice roll to encode.

        R - The type of the dice rolls that was used in the given state.
        Parameters:

        builder - The builder into which to append the encoded move.

        S - The type of state that is stored for each player.
        R - The type of rolls that may be made.
